alert.note: Alert for Crosby; Dickens; Floyd; Lubbock; Motley (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Lubbock (Lubbock and South Plains Texas)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 09 at 7:43PM CDT by NWS Lubbock
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northwestern Dickens, eastern Lubbock, southern Floyd, Crosby and southwestern Motley Counties through 815 PM CDT... At 743 PM CDT, the public reported strong thunderstorms along a broken line extending from Dougherty to 6 miles east of Cone to 3 miles west of Idalou. Movement was southeast at 30 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...57 MPH wind reported at New Deal West Texas Mesonet. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Slaton, Crosbyton, White River Lake, Idalou, Ralls, Lorenzo, Ransom Canyon, Cone, Dougherty, Afton, Caprock, Mcadoo and Buffalo Springs. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Light accumulations of small hail will be possible. Consider moving to a sturdy shelter until this storm passes.
